title: Guardians' Clase, Ortiz indicted for pitch rigging
content: Cleveland Guardians pitchers Emmanuel Clase and Luis Ortiz have been indicted on a host of charges related to an alleged scheme to rig bets on pitches thrown in MLB games. Ortiz is in custody.

title: Giants QB Dart suffers concussion against Bears
content: Giants rookie quarterback Jaxson Dart was ruled out in the fourth quarter against the Bears with a concussion.

title: Texas returns to top 10; ACC places five in poll
content: The Texas Longhorns returned to the top 10 of the Associated Press college football poll, while the ACC has five teams ranked for the first time this season.

title: Taylor runs wild in Berlin: 244 yards, OT winner
content: Jonathan Taylor ran for 244 yards, set the Colts touchdown record and scored a walk-off TD in overtime that allowed Indy to pull off a 31-25 win over the Falcons in Berlin on Sunday.

title: Ex-NFL commissioner Tagliabue dies at age 84
content: Paul Tagliabue, who served as NFL commissioner for 17 seasons as the league experienced tremendous prosperity and growth, died Sunday morning at the age of 84, his family announced.

title: Ex-All-Star Oladipo joins Bucks' G League team
content: Two-time NBA All-Star Victor Oladipo is joining the Wisconsin Herd, the Milwaukee Bucks' G League affiliate.

title: Fit check: USC jersey-swap fake illegal, B1G says
content: The Big Ten says USC should have been assessed a 15-yard unsportsmanlike conduct penalty stemming from the Trojans' fake punt in which a backup quarterback wearing the same number as the punter threw for a first down.

title: 8-seed Gotham shun 'underdog' tag, stun Current
content: Katie Stengel scored the winning goal and helped to clinch a 2-1 victory for Gotham FC over the Kansas City Current in the quarterfinals of the National Women's Soccer League playoffs Sunday.

title: What did we learn in NFL Week 10? Our big takeaways and looming questions off every single game
content: Our NFL Nation reporters answer the biggest questions from each game. Here's what we learned from Week 10.

title: Man City show their potential by capping big week with signature win over Liverpool
content: In seven days, Man City have beaten Bournemouth, Dortmund, and now Liverpool. Pep Guardiola & Co. are officially back to their best.

title: VAR Review: Why Van Dijk's Liverpool goal was disallowed, Doku penalty
content: Liverpool scored an equalizer against Manchester City. But why was it given offside for a player standing in front of the goalkeeper?

title: NFL draft risers, questions and notes: Do we finally have a clear QB1 in the class?
content: Has Indiana's Fernando Mendoza separated himself from the QB pack? We have NFL draft notes through CFB Week 11.

title: USC's sneaky fake punt, newlywed Texas Tech fans top college football Week 11 superlatives
content: USC got tricky with its jersey numbers for a fake punt, Texas Tech fans made it to "College GameDay" after a wedding and more from Week 11.

title: 'Never seen anything like this': Cignetti leads best quips of Week 11 in college football
content: Curt Cignetti and Joey McGuire were among the coaches to sound off with memorable quotes after Week 11.

title: ‚ÜîÔ∏è Winners, losers of a wild NFL trade deadline
content: Well, things escalated quickly. Which teams made the best -- and worst -- moves before the NFL trade deadline? We're making sense of all the action.

title: üí∞ Best fits for top MLB free agents
content: Free agency starts at 5 p.m. ET Thursday. Here are some pairings we'd love to see as this winter gets underway.

title: ‚öæ Sources: Japanese home run king Murakami posts
content: Japanese star third baseman Munetaka Murakami, who owns the single-season home run record for a Japanese player in Nippon Professional Baseball, is entering the posting system for MLB teams, sources told ESPN.

title: üìà Ohio St., IU, Texas A&M, Bama top CFP ranking
content: In the first rankings of the College Football Playoff, coach Ryan Day and unbeaten Ohio State topped the list, followed by Big Ten foe Indiana at No. 2 with Texas A&M third and Alabama landing at four.

title: ‚öæ Former MLB star Strawberry pardoned by Trump
content: President Donald Trump has pardoned former MLB great Darryl Strawberry, the 1983 NL Rookie of the Year and an eight-time All-Star, of tax evasion and drug charges dating back to the latter part of his playing career.

title: Pump fake: Dowdle, Jones hold off on Hingle McCringleberry celebration
content: Dowdle, who was fined for recreating the iconic "Key & Peele" character's celebration, stopped short of another fine -- and Jones followed suit.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Chelsea, Spurs tracking Juventus striker David
content: Chelsea and Tottenham Hotspur are poised to make a move for Canada international striker Jonathan David. Transfer Talk has the latest news and rumors.

title: Trophy-hunt syndicate busted: Elite ‚Äòsafari‚Äô hunts ran from Bhopal; 60+ kills tracked
content: A year after 3 Mumbai youths were arrested with wildlife meat, probe reveals poaching based on southern African game hunts

title: 'Exposing corrupt journalists': Trump reacts to BBC boss Tim Davie stepping down
content: Donald Trump thanked The Telegraph for exposing what he called "corrupt journalists" at the BBC following the resignation of Director-General Tim Davie. Trump alleged the BBC doctored his January 6th speech to appear to encourage violence, accusing the broadcaster of trying to influence a US presidential election.

title: Bill Gates on foundation‚Äôs role; not replacing US aid: ‚ÄòThat‚Äôs not our job‚Äô
content: The Gates Foundation has pledged $2.5 billion over five years to advance global women's health, marking a significant increase in their investment. This funding will primarily support research and development for innovations like self-injectable contraceptives and rapid STI diagnostics, aiming to address long-overlooked health disparities and catalyze broader action.

title: ‚ÄòAnyone can buy Tesla stock right now‚Äô: Elon Musk sends open invite
content: Tesla shareholders approved Elon Musk's $1 trillion pay package, contingent on ambitious growth targets. Musk must achieve significant milestones in market value, revenue, and profitability, including a $400 billion EBITDA goal, to unlock the full payout. These challenging objectives underscore Musk's commitment to Tesla's future in AI and robotics.

title: Arunachal class 10 student dies by ‚Äòsuicide‚Äô in hostel washroom
content: A 19-year-old Class XI student, Tato Podo, died by suicide at St Xavier‚Äôs International School in Arunachal Pradesh. Discovered in a bolted washroom with a necktie, preliminary investigation and CCTV footage, corroborated by his family, indicated no foul play. The family declined a post-mortem, opting for traditional rites.

title: 'Success takes time': Nvidia CEO tells Zuckerberg- here's what he said
content: Nvidia's Jensen Huang and Meta's Mark Zuckerberg shared insights on AI's future and building tech empires. Huang humorously wished he'd dropped out like Zuckerberg, while both acknowledged their long journeys and mutual admiration. Nvidia's remarkable rise to a $5 trillion valuation was highlighted, contrasting with Zuckerberg's own dorm-room beginnings leading to Meta's trillion-dollar status.

title: Can Muslims join RSS? Mohan Bhagwat answers; explains who is 'not allowed' in Sangh
content: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat stated the organization welcomes individuals from all faiths, including Muslims and Christians, provided they identify as "sons of Bharat Mata" and part of Hindu society. He clarified that the RSS focuses on unity and a shared national identity, not caste or religion, and defended its legal standing as a recognized organization.

title: Tom Brady reacts as Fox Sports swaps Mark Sanchez for Drew Brees
content: Tom Brady reacts to Drew Brees replacing Mark Sanchez at FOX Sports as the network cuts ties with Sanchez amid his felony case. Brady‚Äôs accuracy comment, Brees‚Äô career stats and statements, and FOX‚Äôs broadcast shakeup headline a major shift. Full details on Brees‚Äô new role, Sanchez‚Äôs exit and what Brady‚Äôs reaction means for FOX Sports.

title: Klay Thompson apologizes to Megan Thee Stallion after airport pickup mishap
content: Dallas Mavericks star Klay Thompson went viral for his heartfelt apology and remorse after arriving late to pick up girlfriend Megan Thee Stallion from the airport. He presented her with flowers, expressing genuine regret, which fans found "adorably human." The couple's authentic connection continues to charm audiences as they both thrive in their careers.

title: Joe Alwyn‚Äôs clover photo sparks Swiftie claims of quiet nod to Taylor Swift
content: Swifties believe Joe Alwyn‚Äôs Instagram photo featuring a heart-shaped dish with a four-leaf clover was a subtle show of support for Taylor Swift‚Äôs $360 million masters buyback deal. Fans linked the clover to Shamrock Capital, interpreting the image as a quiet nod to Swift‚Äôs victory, even though Alwyn never addressed it publicly.

title: Paul Tagliabue death: How former NFL commissioner died at 84
content: Former NFL Commissioner Paul Tagliabue, who led the league from 1989 to 2006, passed away at 84 due to heart failure linked to Parkinson's disease. During his tenure, Tagliabue oversaw significant growth, including league expansion, stadium development, and global reach, transforming the NFL into a global powerhouse. He is remembered for his strong leadership and dedication to the sport.

title: Bihar: Gopalganj locals set police vehicle on fire after rumour of biker death in accident; probe on
content: A mob in Gopalganj, Bihar, set a police vehicle ablaze. This happened after rumors circulated that a bike rider had died in an accident. Police stated three youths on a motorcycle swerved to avoid a speeding Scorpio, resulting in an accident. They were hospitalized. Authorities are investigating the accident and will take action against those responsible for the arson.

title: 'Worst president in US history': Trump slams 'sleepy, crooked' Biden
content: Donald Trump declared Joe Biden the "worst President in American history," citing economic decline, border security failures, and a "humiliating" Afghanistan withdrawal. Trump accused Biden of being "dominated by radical handlers" and "weaponising law enforcement" against political opponents, asserting that Biden's perceived weakness emboldened global adversaries.

title: Pune land deal row: Ajit Pawar defends son Parth again; terms charges 'random' accusations
content: Maharashtra Deputy CM Ajit Pawar defended his son Parth Pawar against allegations of irregularities in a Pune land deal, calling them "random accusations" ahead of local elections. He stated an inquiry is underway into the sale of government land to a company linked to his son, assuring the truth will emerge soon.

title: BBC boss Tim Davie resigns; cites Trump speech editing row
content: BBC Director-General Tim Davie and News CEO Deborah Turness have resigned following a major controversy over a Panorama documentary. The program allegedly misedited Donald Trump's speech, making it seem he intended to march on the US Capitol. An internal dossier revealed editorial failures, sparking widespread anger and prompting calls for accountability.

title: Naya Zia moment? Pak's 27th amendment boosts Munir‚Äôs 'taj-e-saltanat'; Oppn readies mass protests
content: Pakistan is set to vote on a significant constitutional amendment next week. This proposal seeks to reshape the military's leadership structure and reform the judiciary. Opposition parties are strongly protesting, calling the changes a threat to the constitution. Legal experts are divided on the potential impact of these sweeping reforms.

title: Star Wars: Germany, UK say Russia and China are stalking their satellites‚Äî space spying explained
content: Germany and the United Kingdom have raised alarms over Russian and Chinese satellite interference, reporting their own assets are being stalked and jammed weekly. These actions pose significant risks to critical military communication and navigation systems, prompting increased investment in space security and a warning from Nato about potential attacks.

title: Pro-Trump desis, caught in MAGA Civil War, flee from GOP
content: MAGA movement's nativist fervor is backfiring on Indian-American conservatives like Dinesh D'Souza and Kash Patel, who face xenophobic attacks from far-right groups. This internal conflict highlights the precarious position of minority allies within a movement built on white Christian nationalism, leading to potential GOP defections.

title: ‚ÄòLike always‚Äô: Cong distances itself from Tharoor‚Äôs praise for Advani; cites 'liberal spirit'
content: Congress has distanced itself from Shashi Tharoor's praise for BJP veteran L.K. Advani, calling his remarks his own. These comments followed after the Thiruvananthapuram MP defended Advani's long public service, comparing it to assessing Congress icons. This isn't the first time Tharoor's cross-party compliments have caused friction with the party leadership.

title: 'People against tariffs are fools': Trump slams US SC; promises '$2k benefit' per person
content: President Donald Trump strongly defended his tariff policies. He stated these measures have enriched America and made it the world's most respected nation.  The US Supreme Court is currently reviewing the president's authority to impose import duties.  Trump argued that tariffs are essential for national security and economic prosperity.  The court's decision could significantly impact future presidential trade powers.

title: IPL: Why Samson to DC stopped at the last minute and reached CSK; again!
content: Sanju Samson's potential move from Rajasthan Royals is back on the table with Chennai Super Kings after a deal with Delhi Capitals fell through. RR had initially sought Ravindra Jadeja from CSK, but negotiations are now exploring other CSK players like Matheesha Pathirana or Sam Curran. The outcome remains uncertain, with Samson possibly heading to CSK or entering the auction.

title: Bigg Boss Malayalam 7 winner: TV actress Anumol lifts the trophy
content: Anumol has been crowned the winner of Bigg Boss Malayalam Season 7, securing the trophy, a car, and ‚Çπ45 lakh after 99 days. She becomes the second female contestant to win the title, triumphing over fierce competition with her strong personality and resilience. Her journey was marked by candid opinions and unwavering authenticity, ultimately leading her to victory.

title: Joint power on play: Army conducts Exercise Brahma Shira in Rann, Creek Sector - video
content: The Army successfully conducted Exercise Brahma Shira in the Rann and Creek Sector as part of the Tri-Services Exercise Trishul. This joint drill involved the Army, Navy, Air Force, Coast Guard, and BSF, alongside civil administration, to enhance multi-domain operational capabilities. The exercise highlighted the Army's modernization efforts and integration of advanced infrastructure for challenging terrains.

title: Assam: Gun licences for 'vulnerable' indigenous locals; Himanta sets Feb target
content: Assam's CM announced that the state will issue firearm licenses to indigenous people in vulnerable and remote areas by February 2026. This selective initiative aims to address security concerns for minority indigenous populations, particularly near the Bangladesh border, fulfilling a long-standing demand.

title: Weight loss vs fat Loss: What is better for blood sugar patients
content: Losing weight is often discussed for health, but fat loss is key for insulin sensitivity.  Focusing on reducing fat, particularly around the abdomen and liver, significantly improves how the body handles blood sugar.  This approach helps restore insulin response and promotes better metabolic health for the long term.  Prioritizing fat reduction over just scale numbers leads to lasting health benefits.

title: Delhi pollution: Citizens protest against toxic air in Capital; demand action
content: Delhi residents, joined by AAP leader Priyanka Kakkar, protested at India Gate demanding government action on severe air pollution.  Protesters voiced anger over perceived government denial and inaction, highlighting the hazardous AQI levels. They called for concrete policies and transparency, criticizing failed experiments and urging for permanent solutions to protect citizens' lives.

title: Afghanistan slam Cricket Australia for boycotting bilateral series
content: Afghanistan's chief selector, Asadullah Khan, has slammed Cricket Australia's refusal to play bilateral series, deeming it unfair and political. He argued that linking cricket with the Taliban's restrictions on women's rights isolates Afghanistan's merit-based team. Khan expressed gratitude to India and the BCCI for their support, while expressing confidence in Afghanistan's T20 World Cup chances.

title: 'Why would Gen-Z listen to him?': PK questions Rahul's influence; plays down his impact
content: Prashant Kishor dismisses Rahul Gandhi's influence over Bihar's Gen Z voters, citing his limited engagement and understanding of the state. Kishor argues that Bihar's youth, driven by unemployment and migration, are politically active but not swayed by calls to protect democracy or accusations of vote theft. He also deems the Congress party's role in Bihar as marginal.

title: World Cup: 'I was just thinking ...' - Shafali Verma reveals mindset behind final heroics
content: Shafali Verma revealed her calm and focused mindset during India's ICC Women's World Cup final victory. Despite initial nerves on the big stage, she concentrated on executing her plans, prioritising the team's win over personal milestones. Verma also highlighted the importance of hard work, self-belief, and her family's support in her journey.

title: ‚ÄòThey were holding a grudge‚Äô: Teen shoots schoolmate with father‚Äôs pistol; 2 accused arrested
content: A 17-year-old boy allegedly shot his schoolmate with his father's licensed pistol in Gurgaon's Sector 48, leaving the victim critically injured. The accused and another minor friend were apprehended shortly after the incident. Police recovered the weapon and ammunition from the rented accommodation, with the motive reportedly stemming from a two-month-old argument.

title: Bigg Boss 19: Abhishek Bajaj and Neelam Giri evicted in double elimination
content: Bigg Boss 19's Weekend Ka Vaar saw a shocking double eviction as Abhishek Bajaj and Neelam Giri were sent home. Captain Pranit More saved Ashnoor Kaur, leaving her and others emotional. The unexpected departures highlighted the intense emotional bonds formed within the house.

title: Cardiologist warns: 5 everyday drugs that are quietly damaging your heart
content: Common medicines can harm your heart. Cardiologist Dr. Dimitry Yaranov warns about five drug types. Painkillers, chemotherapy drugs, stimulants, some diabetes medicines, and decongestants pose risks. These can raise blood pressure, weaken the heart, or cause irregular rhythms. Awareness and doctor consultation are key to protecting cardiovascular health. Stay informed about your medications.

title: ‚ÄòRahul mentally unstable‚Äô: BJP slams MGB over ‚Äòpower greed‚Äô; counters 'vote-chori' claim
content: Uttar Pradesh deputy chief minister Keshav Prasad Maurya is confident of a massive majority for the NDA in Bihar. He stated the alliance led by Nitish Kumar will form the government. Maurya dismissed allegations of vote theft by the opposition. He believes the people of Bihar trust Prime Minister Modi and chief minister Nitish Kumar.

title: Who is Akash Kumar? Meghalaya batter who broke world record for fastest First-Class fifty
content: Meghalaya's Akash Kumar etched his name in cricketing history by smashing the fastest-ever First-Class fifty in just 11 balls during a Ranji Trophy match. The 25-year-old's explosive innings, featuring eight consecutive sixes, shattered the previous world record and stunned onlookers.  Kumar's remarkable feat has propelled him into global cricketing immortality.

title: Delhi's Civic Battle Heats Up As BJP And AAP Announce MCD Bypoll Candidates
content: The stage is set for a high-stakes civic showdown in the national capital as both the BJP and the Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) on Sunday unveiled their candidates for the upcoming by-elections to 12 wards of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD).

title: "Planted News": Mukesh Sahani On Reports Of Rift With Grand Alliance
content: Mukesh Sahani, the chief of Vikassheel Insaan Party, today denied reports that he is unhappy with Mahagathbandhan and is about to switch sides and join the NDA.

title: "Health Emergency, Not Blame Game": Delhi Air Pollution Protesters Detained
content: Scores of people staged a protest near India Gate on Sunday, holding placards that read "Smog se Azadi!" and "Breathing is killing me" as Delhi's AQI touched 370.

title: BBC Director-General Resigns Amid Backlash Over Edited Trump Speech
content: The director general of Britain's BBC, Tim Davie, and the chief executive of news, Deborah Turness, have resigned following criticism that a BBC documentary misled viewers by editing a speech by US President Donald Trump.

title: 35-Year-Old Man Murders Wife With Hammer In Front Of Children After Fight
content: A 35-year-old man killed his wife in front of their children using a hammer and a knife in the Bokaro district of Jharkhand in the early hours of Sunday, police said.

title: UP Student, Denied To Sit For Exam Over Fees, Burns Self To Death: Cops
content: A college student, who set himself ablaze after allegedly being denied permission to appear in an examination over non-payment of fees in Budhana town of this district, succumbed to his injuries at a Delhi hospital on Sunday evening, police said.

title: Exclusive: Inside Pak's Secret Unit 'S1' That Trains Terrorists To Attack India
content: A unit called "S1" in Pakistan's Inter-Services Intelligence (ISI) has played a big role in exporting terror to India, way back from the Mumbai blasts in 1993 to the recent terror attack on tourists in Jammu and Kashmir's Pahalgam.

title: Assam Passes Bill To Ban Polygamy, But With Exceptions
content: The Assam Cabinet has approved a Bill to prohibit polygamy in the state, Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma announced on Sunday after a Cabinet meeting held at Lok Sewa Bhawan in Guwahati.

title: "Congress Created Telangana...": Revanth Reddy Ahead Of Jubilee Hills Bypoll
content: Telangana Chief Minister A Revanth Reddy launched a powerful attack on the previous Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) regime on Sunday.

title: "Hope To Resume Repatriation": UNHCR India Chief On Lankan Refugees
content: The United Nations Refugee Agency is working closely with the Colombo Mission to resume the voluntary repatriation of Sri Lankan refugees.

title: Legal Aid Not Merely Act Of Charity But Moral Duty: Chief Justice BR Gavai
content: CJI BR Gavai said legal aid is not merely an act of charity but a moral duty, and those engaged in the legal aid movement must approach their role with an administrative imagination to ensure the rule of law extends to every corner of the country

title: Taliban 'Concerned' After Being Left Off Guest List From UN Climate Summit
content: The Taliban government expressed its disappointment Sunday that it was not invited to the COP30 conference despite Afghanistan being one of the nations most vulnerable to climate change.

title: 7 Dead, 13 Rescued After Myanmar Migrant Boat Overturns Near Malaysia
content: Rescuers in Malaysia recovered the bodies of seven migrants from Myanmar and found 13 alive from a boat that capsized with dozens aboard, officials said Sunday.

title: Tejas, Rafale Shine Over Brahmaputra During Air Force's Grand Flypast In Assam
content: A grand flypast by Indian Air Force aircraft, including Tejas and Rafale, over the Brahmaputra captivated spectators on Sunday at an air show organised in Guwahati as part of the Force's 93rd anniversary celebrations, an official said.

title: 4 Killed, 11 Injured After Car Fleeing Police Slams Into Bar In US
content: A speeding car fleeing police slammed into a crowded bar early Saturday, killing four people and injuring 11 in a historic district of Tampa, Florida, that is known for its nightlife and tourists.

title: Decade After Paris Agreement, Experts Say World Has 'Failed' To Halt Warming
content: The world has changed dramatically in the decade since leaders celebrated a historic climate agreement in Paris a decade ago, but not quite in ways they expected or wanted.

title: Furnace, "I Love You" Text: How Pune Man Tried To Cover Up Wife's Murder
content: In a shocking case from Pune that seemed like the plot of a Bollywood thriller, a man allegedly murdered his wife last month, burned her body in a makeshift furnace and then repeatedly visited the police station to mislead investigators.

title: Sheikh Hasina Aide's "Clinton-Yunus" Bombshell And A Big Charge Against USAID
content: A humanitarian agency of the US government and the Clinton family were behind the uprising in Bangladesh that led to Sheikh Hasina's ouster in 2024, a top aide of the former prime minister has alleged in an interview with Russia Today.

title: Massive X Outage, Users Say Unable To Post Content; Working Now
content: Elon Musk-run X suffered multiple outages in India on Monday, going down for the third time after first experiencing disruptions around 3:30 pm, according to reports. As of now, the platform remains inaccessible for thousands of users.

title: Week 11 intel: Auburn fallout, Texas' moves and biggest visits
content: the recruiting trail has heated up this week as the clock ticks down on the 2026 class . Ohio State, Texas and Texas Tech are among the programs charging for late-cycle flips . the market for premium defensive tackles, led by fall decommits Danny Beale, Dylan Berymon and Emanuel Ruffin, is intensifying this month .

title: Keegan-Michael Key talks to Panthers after Rico Dowdle's pump fine
content: quarterback's quarterback was fined $14,491 for his pelvic-pump celebration . comedian Keegan-Michael Key showed up on the big screen . canales surprised his players by having him clarify why the league fined him . "let's get an expert," canales said .

title: 2 SPOs in Kathua dismissed from job for links with terrorists
content:
.

JAMMU: Two special police officers (SPOs) in Jammu and Kashmir‚Äôs Kathua district have been dismissed from service for allegedly aiding terrorists in their activities. ‚ÄúSPOs Abdul Latif and Mohammad Abbas have been booked... There is no place for terror sympathizers or anti-national elements in Jammu and Kashmir police,‚Äù an official said. Meanwhile, police continued inspections of SIM card vending outlets across Kathua district for the second consecutive day on Sunday. ‚ÄúThis initiative aims to strengthen the verification process for new SIM registrations and curb the potential misuse of mobile connectivity,‚Äù the official added. Vendors were instructed to maintain accurate records of all transactions and strictly follow procedures for collecting and verifying identity documents such as Aadhaar cards, voter IDs, and other valid proofs. SSP Mohita Sharma said negligence or non-compliance with KYC guidelines could invite strict action, including legal proceedings.

End of Article

title: Asia Cup gold medallist kayaker run over by truck
content:
Representative image

BHOPAL: Two Indian Navy kayakers, including an Asia Cup gold medallist, were killed after a speeding truck rammed into their motorcycle and dragged it for nearly 20 metres in Bhopal early Sunday, reports Ramendra Singh. The deceased - chief petty officer Vishnu Raghunathan, 27, and petty officer Ananth Krishnan, 18, both from Kerala - were in Bhopal for a training camp with their naval unit. Raghunathan had won the gold medal in the 1000 m K-2 category at the 2024 Asia Cup in Hong Kong and earlier secured a bronze at an open international championship held in Bhopal in 2019. Rohit Nagar SHO said the accident occurred near Mubarakpur toll plaza between 2.30 am and 3 am. The truck sped away after the collision. Police said toll booth records and CCTV footage are being examined to identify and trace the truck and its driver.

End of Article

title: At 144%, big jump in Somalia tourist arrivals
content: the poor east african country is the only one to register a triple digit growth rate . india had 99.5 lakh FTAs in CY (calendar year) 2024 . the travel industry expects to breach pre-Covid numbers either this year or next year .

title: The torch of American progressive history is being passed to a new generation: Corey Robin on Mamdani‚Äôs victory
content: Zohran Mamdani‚Äôs win as New York City‚Äôs Mayor is a triumph of a kind of democratic action that the country has not seen in a long time, says political theorist Corey Robin; he has made it very clear that the fight against authoritarianism and the fight for affordability are two sides of the same coin, Robin adds

title: Disruption grows in Uttar Pradesh industrial clusters due to U.S. tariffs as demand for bailout grows louder
content: Amid the crisis opposition Samajwadi Party demanded urgent, targeted government intervention through liquidity, wage support, and new market access to prevent a transitory shock from becoming a prolonged humanitarian and economic crisis in the State.

title: Trinamool Congress continues to blame SIR for unnatural deaths in West Bengal
content: The SIR exercise began on November 4. Between October 28 and November 7, at least 11 deaths‚Äîincluding six by suicide and two suicide attempt‚Äîhave been highlighted by the Trinamool Congress alleging fear of disenfranchisement through the SIR process.

content: Omni bus operators pay road¬†tax¬†and all India permit charges every¬†90 days,¬†and that amount doubles when they¬†have to¬†pay road tax in other States as well

title: Two persons washed away in Palar river near Arakkonam
content: The deceased were identified as S. Nirmala (40), a wage worker near Vaniyambadi town, and S. Ramesh (40), who works as lab technician at Government Stanley Hospital in Chennai.

title: Applying the Dravidian algorithm to sports
content: The Tamil Nadu government‚Äôs focus on sports has resulted in more medals and support for sportspersons and para-sportspersons on and off the field

title: All India tourist permit vehicles to stop services to T.N., Karnataka
content: The decision was forced upon the operators as neighbouring States have begun levying heavy fines, imposing unlawful State-level taxes, and seizing All India Tourist Permit buses belonging to Kerala operators, alleges Luxury Bus Owners‚Äô Association

title: Entries invited from food business operators for State government awards
content: Interested FBOs should submit their applications at the office of the Designated Officer (DO) of FSSAI in Cuddalore on or before November 25.

title: Effective BP control can reduce risk of stroke, say experts
content: Indian Stroke Association experts stress on the need to educate the public on the importance of regular blood pressure monitoring for individuals aged 18 and above

title: Kumily continues to lack essential amenities to host Sabarimala pilgrims
content: Thousands of pilgrims from Tamil Nadu, Karnataka, Telangana, and Andhra Pradesh use the Kumily-Mundakkayam-Erumeli-Pampa route to reach the hill shrine

title: I am under threat, my enemies may even get me killed, claims Tej Pratap Yadav
content: The Janshakti Dal chief said, ‚ÄòMy security has been increased... I am under threat. My enemies may even get me killed. Everyone seems like an enemy.‚Äô

title: Assam Cabinet approves Bill to ban polygamy, victims to get compensation
content: Addressing a press conference after a Cabinet meeting, Mr. Sarma said the government will also create a new fund to compensate the victims of polygamy so that they do not face hardship in continuing with their lives.

title: Survey, mapping of KWA pipelines within Kochi Corporation limits begin
content: The topographical survey has begun simultaneously in different Corporation wards, and it will soon be followed by a consumer survey

title: Question paper mix-up hits Manipur civil services exam
content: The Manipur Public Service Commission cancelled two papers of General Studies after candidates received the wrong set

title: Bihar to get young, energetic CM in Tejashwi, says Akhilesh Yadav; cites winds of change
content: Akhilesh Yadav said the RJD-led Mahagathbandhan and INDIA bloc are heading towards victory in Bihar, and their success will further strengthen the alliance nationally after the polls

title: Congress says NDA ‚Äòconceding defeat‚Äô in Bihar Assembly polls
content: Addressing presspersons in Patna, Congress leader Pawan Khera claimed that following the high voter turnout in the first phase and growing public support for the Opposition INDIA bloc ahead of the final phase on November 11, NDA leaders have begun vacating their official residences

title: Along with the BJP, descendants of Bankim Chandra highlight neglect to writer‚Äôs house in Kolkata

title: Kochi City police register 30 NDPS cases in special drive

title: KSRTC‚Äôs initiative for visually challenged passengers wins national award
content: KSRTC‚Äôs Dhwani Spandana project, a first-of-its-kind initiative for visually impaired passengers received the honour for its work in creating an inclusive and accessible public transport system.

title: Stalin says SIR enumeration form is full of confusion, warns of likely deletion of voters‚Äô names

title: Minor girl gang-raped after being dragged to school premises in Madhya Pradesh; three held
content: The two accused men have been sent to judicial custody by a court while the minor accused has been sent to a juvenile home.

title: 2 kids dead as school bus falls 150ft down ghat section in Maharashtra
content:
Representative image

NASHIK: An eight-year-old boy and a 14-year-old girl were killed and more than 30 others injured when the school bus they were travelling in fell more than 150 feet down a ghat section in Maharashtra's Nandurbar district Sunday, reports Santosh Sonawane. Inspector Sarang Navalkar of the local Akkalkuwa police station said the injured students are in the age group of 6 to 17 years. "There were 52 students in the bus at the time of the accident," he said. Students were from an aided ashramshala for tribal students in Jalgaon district and had come home for Diwali vacations. "On Sunday afternoon, the bus arrived to take them back to the ashramshala. The driver, while descending the Amlibari ghat section, lost control at a turning, causing the bus to fall nearly 150 feet into a stream," Navalkar said. Police were in the process of registering an FIR against the bus driver.

End of Article

title: Rape accused out on bail violates 13-year-old
content: Divya Prakash alias Abhinav, 35, allegedly broke into the house of another girl, 13, and raped her . the girl's parents were asleep and her siblings were at their grandparents' house at the time of the crime . she allegedly heard a sound near the window and woke up . on finding the window's plywood removed, she hid herself under the bed .

title: Predicting matchups for the CFP and every bowl game after Week 11's thrillers
content: the Big Ten provided the biggest thrills in Week 11, with Indiana and Oregon both narrowly fending off upsets in dramatic fashion . but Texas Tech delivered the biggest win of the weekend, handing BYU its first loss of the season and securing its standing as the team to beat in the Big 12 . the other eight teams will meet in first-round games at the campus sites of seeds Nos. 5 through 8.

title: How to watch ESPN amid Disney-YouTube TV blackout
content: the blackout affects ABC, the ESPN networks, the Disney-branded channels, Freeform, the FX networks and the Xfinity network . the conflict affects the channel's ability to carry Disney programming . if you don't have cable access, you can get instant access to ESPN content through a variety of services including Cox, Dish, DirecTV, Fios, Fubo, Hulu + Live TV, Mediacom, Optimum, Sling, Spectrum TV and

title: AP Week 11 poll reaction: What's next for each Top 25 team
content: in one of the wildest finishes of the season, Indiana managed to keep its undefeated season alive with a late drive against Penn State . in the only top-10 vs. top-10 matchup, Texas Tech dominated BYU . after its quarterback left the game with an injury, Virginia lost to Wake Forest .

title: Woman tries to kill daughter & self, kin link it to Bengal SIR
content: a 27-year-old homemaker in the Hooghly district consumed pesticide . she fed her daughter the pesticide and had it herself in a fit of despair . her family claimed she panicked as she suspected her SIR form would be issued only at the house of her estranged in-laws .

title: 4-year-old raped, dumped in Bengal; kin held
content:
.

TARAKESWAR: A four-year-old girl was allegedly kidnapped in her sleep, raped and dumped in a locality in Tarakeswar in Bengal's Hooghly district Saturday. Police arrested one of her close relatives, reports Falguni Banerjee. The child lived with her grandparents. Hours after she went missing, locals allegedly found her gravely injured, bleeding profusely, and crying for help near a drain a few hundred metres from Tarakeswar railway station. She was rushed to hospital where doctors treated her wounds and discharged her. Her family, however, alleged that the child had been sexually assaulted. Cops then launched an investigation and had the girl readmitted for a medico-legal examination.

End of Article

title: CJI: Grassroots officials have far deeper sense of local realities than most judges
content: chief justice of india says grassroots level government officials have a deeper understanding of local realities than many Supreme Court and high court judges operating from positions of authority . national conference of national legal aid services authority (nALSA) officials must strive to incorporate the views of grassroots activists and government functionaries while visualizing plans to extend the benefits of legal aid to every citizen .
